forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers before 4pm, then showers and thunderstorms. Cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 14 to 20 mph, with gusts as high as 37 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between three quarters and one inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Showers And Thunderstorms then Mostly Clear
forecast.detailedForecast: Showers and thunderstorms before 10pm. Mostly clear. Low around 44, with temperatures rising to around 46 overnight. West northwest wind 6 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The afternoon brings a somber, gray ambiance to Downtown San Francisco, as rain showers and thunderstorms dance across the skyline, teasing the city with the whispers of moisture. The temperature is a cool 59 degrees, dipping subtly as the afternoon wears on. A brisk west-southwest wind gusts through the streets, reminding passersby of the storm's presence, and an unmistakable sense of urgency hangs in the air, buoyed by an impressive 90% chance of precipitation. Rainfall promises to accumulate, a steady curtain of water that can paint the scene in strokes of fleeting clarity.

As twilight approaches, the night offers a chance of respite, with showers expected to taper off by 10 p.m., giving way to mostly clear skies and a lower temperature around 44 degrees. Yet, the marine layer still clings to the edges of the city, veiling parts of the Golden Gate Bridge in an ethereal mist.
